title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: EU conditionally clears Boeing bid for Spirit AeroSystems
items.summary:
- The EU conditionally approved Boeing's **$4.7‑billion** acquisition of *Spirit AeroSystems*, after remedies addressed competition concerns. 
- Commitments include selling Spirit's European operations to **Airbus** and divesting Spirit's Malaysia site to **Composites Technology Research Malaysia** to preserve competition. 
- EU antitrust chief Teresa Ribera said the remedies should allow a new rival to enter the market and keep parts costs at *competitive* levels.

items.title: TCG Crest sodium-ion battery with 5-min charge
items.summary:
- *India's RISE under TCG Crest has developed the country's first indigenous sodium-ion battery with a 94% charge in five minutes.*
- *The cells deliver ~180 Wh/kg energy density and 10 kW/kg power, showing strong cycling stability and high-temperature performance.*
- *Commercial deployment requires scaling to thousands of cycles and higher-capacity cells, aiming for safer, cost-effective, domestically manufactured storage.*

items.title: Kaynes Semicon rolls out India’s first commercially manufactured multi-chip module
India, South Korea ties get stronger with tech-driven partnership in chips, green energy
Scania opens new China manufacturing hub
items.summary:
- Scania opens its first fully owned factory in *Jiangsu, China*, hedging against global uncertainty to serve *Asia* with tailor-made trucks. 
- The project entails a *€2 billion* investment in *China*, employing about *3,000 workers*, aiming for a capacity of *50,000 vehicles*. 
- CEO *Christian Levin* says it lets Scania deliver tailor-made products with short lead times, growing markets as it leverages *free trade agreements* and *Europe*-like hubs.

items.title: Saatvik Green Energy, its arm bag orders worth ₹689.47 cr for the supply of solar PV modules
Sahasra Semiconductors expands portfolio, begins exports of ‘Made in India’ Micro SD cards
Madhya Pradesh drug manufacturing units ordered to halt production following inspections
LG Electronics India to deepen manufacturing, eyes export growth and tier-II expansion
Global auto giant Stellantis to set up EV manufacturing and export hub in Abu Dhabi
Legacy fabs can be the cheat code to India's semiconductor push
GE Aerospace’s Pune facility marks 10 years of operations
Rajasthan HC orders Centre, FSSAI to establish GM food safety standards
EAAA Alternatives to invest up to 400 bn rupees in clean energy over next five years
India, Saudi Arabia bolster cooperation in chemicals and petrochemicals sector
Steel makers’ margins to shrink even as non-ferrous firms gain in Q2
2 drug units in Madhya Pradesh ordered to halt production
Jindal Stainless launches stainless steel salt tipper trailers for safe transportation
Aviation industry's overall supply chain constrained; co making improvements: GE Aerospace exec
Broadcom to launch new networking chip, as battle with Nvidia intensifies
Heavy lift drone maker BonV Aero delivers 20-kg payload over 60 km
items.summary:
- BonV Aero demonstrated a *20-kg payload* delivery over *60 km* in BVLOS, underscoring advancements in heavy-lift drone capabilities.
- The mission lasted 75 minutes at an average speed of **48 km/h**, showcasing mature propulsion and energy systems for high-endurance use.
- This milestone marks a turning point for domestically developed UAVs in Indian drone logistics, enabling long-range, high-payload BVLOS flights.

items.title: India adds 4.9 GW rooftop solar capacity under PM Surya Ghar scheme; only 13% of target met
Innovation through regulation: QCOs and the future of sustainable FMCG
Aurubis, US talks on new copper smelter
items.summary: - *Aurubis* has held preliminary talks with the *US government* about support for a new *copper smelter* in the United States, after launching a *Georgia recycling plant*. - CEO *Toralf Haag* says a new smelter is a long‑term project, but there are positive signs of potential government backing; near‑term options include expanding the *US recycling operation* or adding a *West Coast plant* that could occur in 3–4 years without aid. - *US demand* for smelting is strong, with about 60 smelters in China and 15 in Europe vs only ~3 in the US, while Aurubis also plans a €500m *Hamburg refinery/recycling complex* to boost *platinum* and *antimony* output.

items.title: WPI inflation in Sept at 0.13% vs 0.52% Aug
items.summary: - *WPI inflation in September 2025 is **0.13% YoY**, driven by price gains in *manufactured food products*, *non-food articles*, *textiles*, and *transport equipment*.*\n- *On a month‑on‑month basis, WPI fell by **0.19%** from August to September 2025.*\n- *Manufactured products rose **2.33% YoY**, while the WPI Food Index slipped to **-1.99% YoY**; Primary Articles and Fuel & Power also eased.*

items.title: India's smartphone exports jump 95% to $1.8B in Sep
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- September smartphone exports rose over 95% YoY to about *$1.8 billion*, per **ICEA**. 
- Apr–Sep 2025 exports hit *$13.5 billion*, up over *60%*, signaling sustained scale in India’s mobile-phone ecosystem. 
- The US accounts for nearly *70%* of Apr–Sep exports, at about *$9.4 billion*, with **ICEA** forecasting around *$35 billion* in FY2025-26.

items.title: L&T partners with Foxconn unit for high-voltage wafers
items.summary:
- **L&T Semiconductor Technologies** has partnered with Foxconn subsidiary **Hon Young Semiconductor (HYS)** to jointly develop **high-voltage wafers (650V–3,300V)**.
- **HYS** provides wafer foundry services for **SiC** and **Si** platforms, enabling collaboration on wafer fabrication for automotive and industrial power solutions with LTSCT's expertise.
- The collaboration will leverage HYS facilities in Taiwan to tailor wafers for automotive/industrial use and build an India-based semiconductor portfolio.

items.title: Chipmaker Nexperia says banned from exporting from China
items.summary:
- Nexperia says *China* banned its exports of goods *manufactured in China* after the Dutch government seized control amid *mismanagement* concerns.
- The company says it is actively engaging with authorities in *Beijing* to obtain an exemption from China's counter-measures.
- The Dutch government invoked a Cold War-era law to take control, with *Wingtech Technology*'s shares placed under an independent administrator.

items.title: Google's gigawatt data-centre aligns with Viksit Bharat
items.summary:
- PM Modi highlighted Google's **gigawatt-scale compute capacity** and the Visakhapatnam AI hub as a key pillar of India's **Viksit Bharat** plan.
- Google announced an AI hub in Visakhapatnam with roughly **$15 billion** investment (2026–2030), including a gigawatt-scale data centre campus and energy infra.
- Developed with AdaniConneX and Airtel, the project aims to democratise AI, boost the digital economy, and cement India’s role as a global tech leader.

items.title: GE Pune facility boosts local high-end manufacturing
items.summary:
- GE Pune is a *ten-year hub* for *jet-engine components* and *advanced skills*, supplying GE90/GE9X/LEAP parts.
- Pune centers *high-value manufacturing* and *skilling*, training 5,000+ associates via apprenticeships, with lean *Flight Deck* operations.
- Last year, ₹240 crore expansion; Bengaluru's 25-year John F Welch Centre; over 1,400 GE/CFM engines power Indian carriers.

items.title: Sterling Gtake rebrands to Sterling E-Mobility Solutions
items.summary:
- *Sterling Gtake* has rebranded to *Sterling E-Mobility Solutions* to broaden its *EV tech portfolio* and signal a shift toward integrated *EV powertrains*.
- The company has advanced partnerships with *AEM*, *Landworld*, and *Jiangsu Gtake* to push *EV powertrains* and *power electronics* across India's EV ecosystem.
- Anil Aggarwal, Chairman, says the rebrand reinforces a commitment to delivering *integrated EV solutions* and broader collaborations for India’s e-mobility future.

items.title: India, Italy explore deeper aerospace ties amid shifting global supply chains
Indian rail equipment makers eye 7-8% of $360B global market
items.summary:
- *India’s railway equipment industry* aims to capture around *7-8%* of a *$360B global market* in *FY2025-26*, driven by *modernization* and growing *exports*.
- *Domestic market* is about *₹2.5 lakh crore*, with manufacturers exporting to *13 countries* and supplying to *20+ railway projects*.
- Exports include over *60,000 steel castings* for bogies and around *1,000 coaches* to *Canada* and *Australia*, signaling strong growth.

items.title: Singapore economy slows in Q3, US tariffs weigh on manufacturing
ED raids Coldrif maker; TNFDA officials
items.summary:
- The ED raided premises linked to *Sresan Pharmaceuticals*, the Coldrif maker, and Tamil Nadu FDA officials in a money-laundering probe tied to Madhya Pradesh deaths.  
- Seven Chennai premises were searched, including Sresan’s key staff and TN FDA chief *Karthikeyan*, as the ED probes whether profits from the adulterated syrup (DEG) are crime proceeds under the **PMLA**.  
- The case follows MP and Tamil Nadu actions after 22 children died from kidney failure due to **DEG**-adulterated Coldrif, with authorities suspending inspectors and the company.

items.title: Indian textile exporters turn to Europe amid US tariffs
items.summary:
- Indian textile exporters are diversifying to the *EU* and offering discounts to US customers to cushion tariffs of up to 50%.
- The United States was India's largest market for textiles and apparel, taking nearly 29% of exports worth about $38 billion in the year to March 2025.
- Trade talks with the *EU* are at a decisive phase, with a year-end target for a free trade pact and exporters meeting tougher EU standards.

items.title: Pulses and oilseeds production increased in Jhansi, Chitrakoot
items.summary:
- *Pulses* and *oilseeds* production in Jhansi-Chitrakoot rose from 23 to 30 LMT, while mustard and raee rose from 12 to 26 LMT after distributing over 45 lakh mini kits.
- The government is pushing **PM Dhan-Dhanya Krishi Yojana** and *Pulses Self-Reliance Mission* to raise farmer incomes and includes 7 districts in Bundelkhand (Jhansi, Jalaun, Lalitpur, Chitrakoot, Banda, Mahoba, Hamirpur).
- Authorities urged farmers to use fertilizers per standard specifications, ensure transparency in the **Farmer Insurance Scheme**, and rely on the **Central Agriculture University** as a productivity booster.

items.title: Steel demand poised to rise 9% in 2025 and 2026
Honeywell: record business jet deliveries next decade
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- *Honeywell* forecasts global deliveries of 8,500 new business jets worth about *$283 billion* over the next decade.
- Demand remains resilient with hours flown in business aviation above pre-COVID levels, driven by affluent travelers.
- The forecast arrives ahead of the Las Vegas show, with *Bombardier* and *Gulfstream* launching new models.

items.title: Airlines face $11B hit from supply chain woes in 2025
items.summary:
- *IATA* and Oliver Wyman warn supply-chain bottlenecks delaying aircraft production and forcing airlines to keep older planes in service. 
- The report estimates a total 2025 impact near **$11 billion**, with **fuel** (+$4.2B), **maintenance** (+$3.1B), **engine leasing** (+$2.6B) and **parts** (+$1.4B). 
- A backlog over 17,000 aircraft and 10.4% demand growth threaten capacity and raise costs for carriers.

items.title: Samsung expects best profit since 2022, as AI boom squeezes commodity chip supply
In rare move, Dutch government takes control of China-owned chipmaker Nexperia
Foxconn to invest ₹15,000cr in Tamil Nadu for EV, tech units
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- *Foxconn* plans to invest about **₹15,000 crore** in Tamil Nadu, focusing on **EV battery** manufacturing and other advanced tech facilities.
- The move could create around **14,000 jobs** and includes a dedicated 'Foxconn Desk' to assist the company.
- The investment aligns with Foxconn's India growth plan, leveraging Tamil Nadu's policies, skilled workforce, and infrastructure.

items.title: Smartphones may contribute over ₹3 lakh cr in taxes during PLI years
Centre unveils ₹6.4 trillion plan to transmit 76 GW hydropower from Brahmaputra basin by 2047
Govt committee on nuclear power bats for up to 49% FDI
items.summary:
- The government is set to amend the Atomic Energy Act and the Civil Liability for Nuclear Damages Act to enable private sector participation in *nuclear energy*, with a committee led by PS Karthigeyan and Ajay Talegaonkar and including DAE, NPCIL, NTPC and BARC.  
- Calls for re-design of the *INIP* insurance via the General Insurance Corporation of India to cover up to Rs 1,500 crore per incident, expanding INIP capacity.  
- The 100 GW target includes 46.5 GW indigenous PHWRs, 38.8 GW PWRs, and 5 GW each from SMRs, SBMRs and FBRs, with new licensing rules for nuclear-fuel handling.

items.title: ONGC aims to cut oil production cost by 15% in two years, save ₹9,000 crore by FY27
OIL, NEEPCO sign 15-year gas pact for Assam plant
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- *OIL* and *NEEPCO* signed a 15-year **Gas Sale and Purchase Agreement** to supply *1.4 MMSCMD* of natural gas to the **AGBPS** at *Bokuloni*, *Dibrugarh*.
- The pact extends the previous *10-year* agreement and aims to ensure stable **gas supply** and regional power security for *Assam* and the *Northeast*.
- *OIL* says the deal reinforces its commitment to domestic gas reserves and supports India's transition to a *gas-based economy*.

items.title: Beer industry seeks import relaxation due to can shortage
items.summary:
- The domestic beer industry faces short-term supply problems as aluminium cans were brought under mandatory BIS certification via a Quality Control Order from April 1, 2025, sparking calls for *short-term regulatory relaxation*.
- Industry estimates a deficit of *12-13 crore units* of 500 ml cans annually (about 20% of beer sales), potentially causing a *₹1,300 crore* hit to government revenues.
- Suppliers *BALL Beverage Packaging India* and *Can-Pack India* have exhausted domestic capacity and expect no increase in supply for 6–12 months, underscoring the need for imports.

items.title: ACME to build 1.2 mt sponge iron plant with green hydrogen
items.author: Nikita Periwal, Kalpana Pathak, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- ACME Group will build a *1.2 Mt/yr sponge iron (DRI) plant* powered by **green hydrogen**, co-located with its hydrogen projects.
- It has a **10-year contract** with Vietnam’s Stavian Industrial Metal for 800,000 t of DRI/HBI, with 400,000 t more being discussed with European buyers.
- Producing 1.2 Mt of DRI/HBI would require about **30,000–50,000 t** of green hydrogen, and Europe’s CBAM from 2026 could boost demand for low-carbon steel.
